intro: Coccothrinax jimenezii, commonly known as Jimenez's palm, is a rare and endemic species native to the island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect trunk and clustered, feather-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Its small, yellowish flowers are followed by clustered fruits that contain edible seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a conservation concern.
